Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stDBMLogicNode< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

Thic class template represents a DBMTree logic node entry. It is used to hold a node in a memory form which allows better way to manipulate entries. It also implements means to distribute its contents between 2 nodes or 3 nodes.

Warning:
This node will take the ownership of all object instances added to this node. It means that the object instance will be destroyed by the destructor of this class.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
stDBMLogicNode< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::~stDBMLogicNode (   ) 
 

Disposes this instance and releases all related resources. All instances of object added to this node will also be deleted unless it is not owned by this node (see method BuyObject()).

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
ObjectType* stDBMLogicNode< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::BuyObject (  stCount  idx  )  [inline]
 

Gets the ownership of an object associated with a given entry. This method will avoid the automatic destruction of the object instance by the destructor of this node.

This method can be used to buy the representative objects to avoid unnecessary replications.

Parameters:
idx The object index.
Returns:
The pointer to the object.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
void stDBMLogicNode< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::Distribute (  tDBMCollection *  returnCollection,
stDBMNode *  node0,
stDBMNode *  node1,
tSubtreeInfo *  promo,
EvaluatorType *  metricEvaluator
) 
 

Distribute objects between 2 nodes using the current representatives (see SetRepresentative()). Some objects may be insert in returnCollection.

The returnCollection has objects that were not inserted in the others nodes.

Parameters:
returnCollection The returning node containing objects that were not covered by the other 2 nodes.
node0 The first node.
node1 The second node.
promo Representatives of node 0 and 1.
metricEvaluator The metric evaluator to be used to compute distances.
